title: AI Index Report 2025 - Stanford HAI
summary: Comprehensive annual report on AI progress showing continued advancement in narrow AI but limited progress toward general intelligence. Expert survey indicates median AGI timeline of 2040-2050.
reasoning: Stanford HAI is a leading academic institution for AI research. The annual AI Index is widely cited and uses rigorous methodology.

title: Survey of AI Researchers on AGI Timelines
summary: Survey of 2,778 AI researchers finds only 10% believe AGI will be achieved by 2030. Majority cite challenges in reasoning, common sense, and transfer learning.
reasoning: Peer-reviewed survey with large sample size of domain experts. Directly addresses the prediction question.

title: GPT-5 Capabilities Analysis - OpenAI Technical Report
summary: Technical report detailing significant improvements in multi-step reasoning, planning, and cross-domain generalization. Model achieves human-level performance on several new benchmarks.
reasoning: Primary source from leading AI lab. Some bias toward optimistic framing but technically detailed and verifiable.

title: The Remaining Challenges for AGI - Nature Machine Intelligence
summary: Review article arguing that despite impressive progress, current systems lack causal reasoning, genuine understanding, and robust world models required for AGI.
reasoning: High-impact peer-reviewed journal with rigorous editorial standards. Provides balanced counterpoint to industry optimism.

title: EIA Monthly Energy Review - January 2025
summary: Official US government data showing renewable energy at 22.1% of total electricity generation in 2024. Solar grew 18% YoY, wind 12%, but fossil fuels still dominate.
reasoning: Official government statistical agency with standardized methodology. Primary authoritative source for US energy data.

title: Grid Infrastructure Bottlenecks Slow Renewable Adoption
summary: Analysis of interconnection queue backlogs showing 2,000+ GW of renewable projects waiting for grid connection. Average wait time now exceeds 5 years.
reasoning: Respected industry publication with good track record. Provides context on infrastructure limitations.

title: EIA Electric Power Monthly - May 2025
summary: Q1 2025 data shows renewables reached 24.3% of electricity generation. Natural gas remains at 38%, coal at 16%. Growth rate insufficient to reach 50% by year end.
reasoning: Official government statistics. Most authoritative source for tracking progress toward the prediction target.

title: Tokyo Statistical Yearbook 2024
summary: Official Tokyo Metropolitan Government statistics showing population of 13.96 million as of October 2024, down 0.2% from previous year.
reasoning: Primary official government source for Tokyo population data. Directly measures the prediction outcome.

title: Remote Work Reshapes Japanese Urban Migration Patterns
summary: Analysis showing continued net outflow from Tokyo to suburban and rural areas as remote work policies become permanent at major Japanese corporations.
reasoning: Reputable English-language Japanese newspaper. Provides useful context on demographic trends.

title: Tokyo Population Estimate - December 2025
summary: Final 2025 population estimate shows Tokyo at 13.91 million, confirming continued decline. Third consecutive year of population decrease.
reasoning: Official government source providing definitive data for prediction resolution.

title: SETI Institute Annual Report 2024
summary: Report summarizing search efforts across radio and optical wavelengths. No candidate signals detected. Coverage remains less than 0.001% of potentially habitable systems.
reasoning: Primary organization conducting SETI research. Authoritative source on search progress and methodology.

title: The Drake Equation Revisited: Updated Estimates
summary: Updated analysis incorporating exoplanet discoveries suggests intelligent civilizations may be extremely rare. Estimated probability of detection by 2030 remains below 1%.
reasoning: Peer-reviewed preprint with updated statistical modeling. Provides theoretical framework for likelihood estimate.

title: Bitcoin Halving Analysis: Historical Price Patterns
summary: On-chain analytics showing post-halving supply shock historically leads to 300-500% price appreciation within 18 months. Current cycle showing similar early patterns.
reasoning: Leading blockchain analytics firm with robust methodology. Historical analysis directly relevant to price prediction.

title: BlackRock Bitcoin ETF Sees Record Inflows
summary: iShares Bitcoin Trust (IBIT) accumulated $15 billion in assets within 6 months of launch, fastest ETF growth in history. Institutional demand exceeding expectations.
reasoning: Major wire service reporting verifiable fund flow data. Institutional adoption is key price driver.

title: Bitcoin Approaches All-Time High Amid ETF Demand
summary: Bitcoin reached $92,000 driven by continued ETF inflows and anticipation of favorable regulatory environment. Trading volume at 18-month highs.
reasoning: Leading crypto news outlet with real-time market coverage. Provides current price context for prediction.

title: Bitcoin Crosses $100,000 Milestone
summary: Bitcoin surpassed $100,000 for the first time on January 18, 2025, reaching intraday high of $103,450. Market cap exceeds $2 trillion.
reasoning: Major financial news outlet confirming prediction resolution. Definitive source for milestone achievement.

title: China Lunar Exploration Program Status Update
summary: CNSA confirms crewed lunar landing remains on track for 2030. Chang'e 7 and 8 missions scheduled for 2026-2028 to prepare landing site.
reasoning: Official Chinese space agency source. Primary authority on program timeline, though may present optimistic framing.

title: Analysis: China's Path to the Moon
summary: Independent assessment concludes China has demonstrated all key technologies for crewed lunar landing. Program shows fewer delays than Western counterparts.
reasoning: Respected space industry publication with track record of accurate analysis. Provides independent verification of official claims.

title: Long March 10 Completes Successful Test Flight
summary: China's new human-rated lunar rocket completed first integrated test flight. Vehicle performed nominally, clearing major milestone for crewed moon mission.
reasoning: Reliable space news source reporting on verifiable launch event. Key technical milestone for prediction.

title: NASA Artemis III Delayed to Late 2027
summary: NASA officially pushes Artemis III crewed lunar landing to no earlier than late 2027, citing Starship HLS development delays and spacesuit readiness.
reasoning: Official NASA announcement. Primary authoritative source for Artemis program timeline.

title: SpaceX Starship HLS Progress Report
summary: SpaceX reports progress on lunar Starship variant but acknowledges orbital refueling demonstrations still pending. Multiple test flights needed before crew rating.
reasoning: Primary source from contractor but may have optimistic bias. Key technical dependency for Artemis timeline.

title: GAO Report: Artemis Program Assessment
summary: Government Accountability Office finds Artemis III schedule 'highly optimistic' and recommends 2028 as more realistic target. Identifies 12 critical path items at risk.
reasoning: Independent government watchdog with no vested interest in program success. Historically accurate on NASA assessments.

title: NASA Budget Request Falls Short of Artemis Needs
summary: FY2026 budget request includes $2 billion less than NASA requested for Artemis program. Lunar program funding flat while costs increase.
reasoning: Respected tech publication with strong space coverage. Budget constraints directly impact timeline feasibility.

title: Starship Achieves Orbital Velocity in Test Flight
summary: Starship completed first successful orbital-class test flight with controlled reentry. Major milestone but lunar variant still requires significant additional development.
reasoning: Primary source on verifiable test achievement. Positive development for Artemis timeline though HLS-specific work remains.

title: China vs NASA: The New Moon Race
summary: Comparative analysis concludes race is competitive. China's methodical approach vs NASA's ambitious but delayed timeline makes outcome uncertain.
reasoning: Prestigious scientific journal providing balanced comparative analysis. Good synthesis of both programs' status.

title: Global Humanoid Robot Market Report 2025
summary: Market analysis estimates 2024 humanoid robot sales at approximately 12,000 units globally. Projected CAGR of 45% still leaves market far below automotive scale by 2030.
reasoning: Established market research firm with reasonable methodology. Provides quantitative baseline for comparison.

title: Global Auto Sales Reach 82 Million in 2024
summary: International Organization of Motor Vehicle Manufacturers reports 82.3 million vehicles sold globally in 2024. Market mature but stable.
reasoning: Official industry body with comprehensive global data. Essential baseline for comparison prediction.

title: Tesla Optimus Production Update
summary: Tesla reports Optimus pilot production reaching 1,000 units per month. Cost target of $20,000 per unit by 2027. Internal deployment at Tesla factories expanding.
reasoning: Primary source but Tesla known for optimistic timelines. Production numbers verifiable through supply chain analysis.

title: Chinese Humanoid Robot Startups See Surge in Funding
summary: Chinese humanoid robot companies raised $4.2 billion in H1 2025. Unitree, Fourier Intelligence, and others scaling production. Government subsidies accelerating adoption.
reasoning: Reputable tech publication tracking startup ecosystem. Funding is leading indicator but not guarantee of sales achievement.

title: Claude 4 Demonstrates Novel Reasoning Capabilities
summary: Technical report showing new model achieves superhuman performance on complex reasoning benchmarks. Demonstrates emergent planning and self-correction abilities.
reasoning: Primary source from major AI lab. Technical claims verifiable but company has incentive to highlight progress.

title: Are We Approaching AGI? Expert Debate Intensifies
summary: MIT Technology Review surveys leading researchers finding growing disagreement on AGI proximity. Some see current trajectory reaching AGI by 2030, others argue fundamental breakthroughs still needed.
reasoning: Respected technology publication presenting balanced expert perspectives. Captures current state of scientific debate.

title: MeerKAT Extension Begins SETI Observations
summary: South African Radio Astronomy Observatory announces dedicated SETI observation program using expanded MeerKAT array. Will increase search coverage 10x over previous efforts.
reasoning: Official announcement from major radio astronomy facility. Credible source on expanded search capabilities.

title: JWST Reveals New Insights on Exoplanet Atmospheres
summary: James Webb Space Telescope identifies potential biosignature gases in atmospheres of two nearby exoplanets. Further observation needed to rule out non-biological sources.
reasoning: Official NASA findings but atmospheric biosignatures are indirect evidence, not SETI detection. Tangentially relevant to prediction.

title: EIA Electric Power Monthly - October 2025
summary: Q3 2025 data shows renewables at 27.2% of US electricity generation. Record solar additions but insufficient to reach 50% target. Year-end projection: 28-29%.
reasoning: Authoritative government source with definitive data. Makes clear 50% target is mathematically unreachable.

title: US Renewable Growth: Strong Progress But Below Targets
summary: IEA assessment finds US renewable growth among fastest globally but policy inconsistency and grid constraints limit acceleration. 50% by 2030 achievable with sustained effort.
reasoning: International Energy Agency provides authoritative global energy analysis. Contextualizes US progress in global trends.
